title: Thoracic Outlet Syndrome Management
content: Thoracic outlet syndrome involves neurovascular compression between the clavicle and first rib. Physical therapy focusing on postural correction, scalene and pectoralis minor stretching, and strengthening of scapular stabilizers is primary treatment. Activity modification and ergonomic adjustments address contributing factors. Surgical decompression, possibly including first rib resection, is considered for severe or refractory neurological or vascular symptoms.
